TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EnvelopeVersion extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2. There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each of these versions of SOAP that can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties. There is also a <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> message version that is used to sent and receive XML messages that do not use SOAP formatting. The processing roles associated with each message version can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.NextDestinationActorValue%2A> property and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.GetUltimateDestinationActorValues%2A> method.
## Examples The following code shows how to access the methods and properties of <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion>.
[!code-csharp[S_UEEnvelopeVersion#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueenvelopeversion/cs/program.cs#0)] [!code-vb[S_UEEnvelopeVersion#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueenvelopeversion/vb/module1.vb#0)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string[] GetUltimateDestinationActorValues() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a string that contains the URI name for the SOAP role associated with the current message version for the ultimate destination.
Docs.returns: An empty string if SOAP1.1 is used; a string that contains http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiver if SOAP1.2 is used.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ultimate receiver is `null` if <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> is specified.

Docs.summary: Gets a string that contains the URI name for the SOAP role associated with the current message version for the next destination.
Docs.value: A string that contains http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/actor/next if SOAP1.1 is used; a string that contains http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/next if SOAP1.2 is used; and an empty string if the message version is none.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property None As EnvelopeVersion
public: static property System::ServiceModel::EnvelopeVersion ^ None { System::ServiceModel::EnvelopeVersion ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the envelope version not using a version of SOAP.
Docs.value: The envelope version not using a SOAP formatting.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> message version is used this means that a SOAP envelope is not written out and the message emits the contents of the body. This enables an Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) channel to communicate with an endpoint that is expecting XML with no SOAP formatting. The XML payload lives in the body of a message and is the only thing emitted when it hits the encoder.
Similarly, when the arbitrary chunk of XML is received it is wrapped up in a Message for propagation up the channel stack. The required headers are inserted and the message is processed as if it had been a SOAP message.
